The Beginning

Like many developers, I started with simple ‚ÄúHello World‚Äù programs. The excitement of seeing text appear on screen after writing just a few lines of code was incredible.

Key Lessons Learned

  1. Consistency beats intensity - Coding a little every day is better than marathon sessions
  2. Build projects - Theory is important, but building real projects teaches you the most
  3. Don‚Äôt be afraid to ask for help - The programming community is generally very supportive
  4. Read other people‚Äôs code - You learn different approaches and best practices
